newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - TAMSA downgraded to buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - TAMSA downgraded to buy.

text.p: Santander Investment analysts Juan Carlos Garcia and Victoria Santaella said they had downgraded to buy from strong buy their rating for Mexican steel pipe maker Tubos de Acero de Mexico SA, or TAMSA.
-- "As a result of delays in Pemex orders and the stronger peso scenario, we are cutting our 1997 and 1998 earnings estimates by 18.2 percent and 17.7 percent, respectively," they said in a report.

-- "We maintain our US$25.00 12-month ADR target price, given that the stock is still trading at a 54 percent discount to its international peers (excluding Japan and Germany). The discount primarily reflects the revaluation of pipe supplier multiples worldwide, given the strong demand from the oil secytor."
-- "Based on our 12-month target price, the shares have 27 percent upside potential, some 10 percent above our estimates for the Mexican stock market over the same period."
-- The company's American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) were down 8/16 at 18-5/16 on the New York Stock Exchange.
